titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Charles B. Edwards was born 1869. In 1913 Edwards was hired by Westinghouse Machine Company and in 1914, the Edwards family moved to England, where he was probably still employed by Westinghouse. Edwards returned to the United States in 1916 and by 1918, Edwards was working mainly in New York, and the family moved to Forest Hills, Long Island and soon thereafter moved again to Haddonfield, NJ. Probably around the same time, he began working for New York Shipbuilding Co. in Camden. By 1932, Edwards was retired.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of diaries kept by Charles B. Edwards. The nine diaries, dating from 1913-20 and 1932, note the weather and daily activities of Edwards. Entries are typically brief. One notebook, kept from 1901 to 1906, lists specifications for a number of ships, including the torpedo boat Lawrence, the cruiser Des Moines, the battleships Pennsylvania, Vermont, Rhode Island, New Jersey, and a number of other ships. This notebook also includes a table of insurance for buildings owned by the Fore River Ship Building Co. The other notebook dating roughly from 1914-1915, contains rough notes and calculations, and is not clearly connected to particular ships.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
